metadata.title: CVE-2025-21673 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:smb: client: fix double free of TCP_Server_Info::hostnameWhen shutting down the server in cifs_put_tcp_session(), cifsd threadmight be reconnecting to multiple DFS targets before it realizes itshould exit the loop, so @server->hostname can't be freed as long ascifsd thread isn't done.  Otherwise the following can happen:  RIP: 0010:__slab_free+0x223/0x3c0  Code: 5e 41 5f c3 cc cc cc cc 4c 89 de 4c 89 cf 44 89 44 24 08 4c 89  1c 24 e8 fb cf 8e 00 44 8b 44 24 08 4c 8b 1c 24 e9 5f fe ff ff <0f>  0b 41 f7 45 08 00 0d 21 00 0f 85 2d ff ff ff e9 1f ff ff ff 80  RSP: 0018:ffffb26180dbfd08 EFLAGS: 00010246  RAX: ffff8ea34728e510 RBX: ffff8ea34728e500 RCX: 0000000000800068  RDX: 0000000000800068 RSI: 0000000000000000 RDI: ffff8ea340042400  RBP: ffffe112041ca380 R08: 0000000000000001 R09: 0000000000000000  R10: 6170732e31303000 R11: 70726f632e786563 R12: ffff8ea34728e500  R13: ffff8ea340042400 R14: ffff8ea34728e500 R15: 0000000000800068  FS: 0000000000000000(0000) GS:ffff8ea66fd80000(0000)  000000  CS:  0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033  CR2: 00007ffc25376080 CR3: 000000012a2ba001 CR4:  PKRU: 55555554  Call Trace:   <TASK>   ? show_trace_log_lvl+0x1c4/0x2df   ? show_trace_log_lvl+0x1c4/0x2df   ? __reconnect_target_unlocked+0x3e/0x160 [cifs]   ? __die_body.cold+0x8/0xd   ? die+0x2b/0x50   ? do_trap+0xce/0x120   ? __slab_free+0x223/0x3c0   ? do_error_trap+0x65/0x80   ? __slab_free+0x223/0x3c0   ? exc_invalid_op+0x4e/0x70   ? __slab_free+0x223/0x3c0   ? asm_exc_invalid_op+0x16/0x20   ? __slab_free+0x223/0x3c0   ? extract_hostname+0x5c/0xa0 [cifs]   ? extract_hostname+0x5c/0xa0 [cifs]   ? __kmalloc+0x4b/0x140   __reconnect_target_unlocked+0x3e/0x160 [cifs]   reconnect_dfs_server+0x145/0x430 [cifs]   cifs_handle_standard+0x1ad/0x1d0 [cifs]   cifs_demultiplex_thread+0x592/0x730 [cifs]   ? __pfx_cifs_demultiplex_thread+0x10/0x10 [cifs]   kthread+0xdd/0x100   ? __pfx_kthread+0x10/0x10   ret_from_fork+0x29/0x50   </TASK>

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2025-21673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1

linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1015.15').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
